panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

matcher.options: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/
/1h Outage SLO \(2% of monthly error budget\).*/

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: gitlab-shell Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{type="gitlab-shell"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{type="gitlab-shell"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="gitlab-shell"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{type="gitlab-shell"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="gitlab-shell"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{type="gitlab-shell"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="gitlab-shell"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{type="gitlab-shell"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="gitlab-shell"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

panels.title: gitlab-shell Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{type="gitlab-shell"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{type="gitlab-shell"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="gitlab-shell"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{type="gitlab-shell"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="gitlab-shell"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{type="gitlab-shell"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="gitlab-shell"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{type="gitlab-shell"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="gitlab-shell"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: gitlab-shell Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_1h{component="grpc_requests",confidence="98%",type="gitlab-shell"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_5m{component="grpc_requests",confidence="98%",type="gitlab-shell"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="grpc_requests",type="gitlab-shell"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_1h{component="grpc_requests",confidence="98%",type="gitlab-shell"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="grpc_requests",type="gitlab-shell"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_30m{component="grpc_requests",confidence="98%",type="gitlab-shell"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="grpc_requests",type="gitlab-shell"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_6h{component="grpc_requests",confidence="98%",type="gitlab-shell"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="grpc_requests",type="gitlab-shell"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.title: grpc_requests SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

A proxy measurement of the number of GRPC SSH service requests made to Gitaly and Praefect.

Since we are unable to measure gitlab-shell directly at present, this is the best substitute we can provide.



### Observability Tools
panels.title: Details
Estimated p95 grpc_requests Latency - per node
Apdex attribution for grpc_requests Latency - per node

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers can have a limit configured on how much CPU they can consume in
a burst. If we are at this limit, exceeding the allocated requested resources, we
should consider revisting the container's HPA configuration.

When a container is utilizing CPU resources up-to it's configured limit for
extended periods of time, this could cause it and other running containers to be
throttled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(container,pod,type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (container,pod,type) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="gitlab-shell"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(container,pod,type) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="gitlab-shell"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="gitlab-shell"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu_limit component saturation: Kube Container CPU over-utilization

panels.description:
This uses the working set size from cAdvisor for the cgroup's memory usage. That may
not be a good measure as it includes filesystem cache pages that are not necessarily
attributable to the application inside the cgroup, and are permitted to be evicted
instead of being OOM killed.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(deployment,type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="gitlab-shell"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="gitlab-shell"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization
